comments.commentBody:
"Not many people can make Santorum look sane and reasonable."
Sentence of the year!

Don't overlook the power to sway people with loud, boisterous statements, unsupported by facts, yet spoken passionately. I think Newt's brand of politics appeals to way more people than we might imagine. He's starting to remind me of Father Coughlin.

I agree with Mr. Blow's essential point, that while Gingrich is scoring points with those who still lament the defeat of segregation which took away their false sense of superiority over black people and a way of life built upon Apartheid and suppression of the black race, it will not play with the general population.

Neither will Romney who flipped flopped at least three time answering one question when asked about his revealing his tax returns, while being reminded by the moderator that his father released his for twelve years. He went from saying he'd wasn't sure when, to saying he would reveal this years returns in April, and when that got boos, he sputtered out that he would reveal a few years.
The man sounds like he has something to hide, and he probably does because he has stashed millions off shore where it becomes converted to part of funds that are secret and almost impossible to decipher where these investments go or who participates in them, be it gun dealers, or other money gotten from ill gotten gains or shady business dealings. This is not money sitting in a bank earning interest as is the image in America. It is laundered and becomes part of international investment funds, Is this the kind of man we want as president?

I think reasonable, moderate Americans will reject Gingrich. He reeks of toxicity.
His venom, narcissism, arrogance, hostility, grandiosity and condescension is disgusting. Not many people can make Santorum look sane and reasonable.

I remember reading an article about H5N1 viruses in Foreign Affairs a few years ago and being frightened by the pandemic implications of this precise airborne mutation.

Personally --and I'm not an expert!-- I'm a little flabbergasted that we are messing around with mutating the virus in the first place. Didn't we sign an International Biological Weapons act prohibiting us from messing around like this back in the early 70's? And, since the created the bloody thing, have they also developed a vaccine against it's antigen pattern??? In my opinion they'd better!
Sometimes academics are so stupid!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I love the "scientists have warned that if it mutates to become more contagious in people, disaster could ensue" ...so what do scientist do...they mutate the virus to do exactly what they are worried about the virus doing on its own.  It just makes so much sense...
This is absurd. Why do we need these kind of viruses? Halt the experiments and do something to eliminate hunger and sicknesses you weirdos
Who in their right mind just for scientific purposes create a dangerous virus and then have people report about it. It boggles my mind. Stop creating viruses to kill humans please!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Attention world! "Now, the world must decide what to do with it."
Guess what Ron Fouchier, you didn't ask the WORLD what to do before you did it and the world is 100% certain you won't be asking us to decide ANYTHING.

I'll feel free here to speak for the WORLD. Had you asked the WORLD ahead of your 'suprise' I'm quite sure the world would have told you to not go forward.

As part of the world, I assure you I have a number of recomendations for you and your suprise discovery none of which would be appropriate for print.

I'm not even going to let myself hate you and your kind for the suprises you will unleash upon the world because that would be worse for my health and soul than anything you can accidently dream up.

The World sees you.

"The saving grace of H5N1 is that when people do become infected — nearly always from contact with birds — they almost never transmit the disease to other people. "  Why?  Because it kills faster than the Ebola virus?
What to do now?.....sounds like the same thing they said when they built nucleur missiles.It might come in handy one day so lets just hang on to it...

The ACLU and some other groups may talk about "freedom" of expression or some such other way to explain their point of view, but, in my opinion, creating such a virus to start with is borderline insanity, and not destroying it would be criminal.  Would anyone in his right mind put a WMD in the hands of someone like Kim Jung Un (sp.?) or other tinpot dictator or criminal?  Don't even try to persuade me otherwise.
Go on guys.  We're awful.  Wipe us out  Give nature a break.

Well, just as the BWRs in Fukushima were safe, there's no need to doubt the safety of Bird Flu Research in the least. Let's move the bio-research lab for Bird Flu to Washington D.C.
Really. What could go wrong? It's a win-win scenario.

Finally, ... intelligence speaks.
Thank you, I was beginning to lose all hope for Man.
you sure hit the nail on the head!
White male priviledge is in its full glory in the manifest destiny of the cloak of exceptionalism that is Newt.
That is what Republicans do when experts present facts that don't square with their fantasy of how the world works. They fire or marginalize them. Ask Shinseki or Powell.

When your advisers give you advice that doesn't square with your original (mis)perceptions, there's only one thing to do- fire your advisers.  Even if Willard-the-job-creator was right about the economy and how to fix it (and he isn't), I'd never vote for him strictly on the basis of his foreign-policy views.  And if he's got the support of blowhard John Bolton, a man who's never met a threat he didn't like, he's already operating on the far side of reality.

Mr. Gingrich refers to his adultery as his “mistakes.”

When I miss the exit on the freeway -- That's a mistake.

When I forget my umbrella --That's a mistake.

When I forget to buy something on the shopping list -- That's a mistake.

But if I were to sleep with a woman who is not my wife -- That is an intentional act!

Mr. Gingrich's posture is a transparent example of the difference between confession and repentance.

It is also a perfect example of the hypocrisy of those who feign to accept what they know is a politically motivated conversion.

Except that Clinton, Kennedy etc. didn't run on a rigid, moralistic, phony "family values" campaign, touting marriage between one man and one woman forever as the only possible morality acceptable to God and country. He was carrying on an extramarital affair with Callista while leading the charge to have Bill Clinton removed for the exact same offense.

The whole issue seems a common problem not just for politicians.  Some are faithful, many are not.  I'm not sure I care, the story is so common.  But Newt's self righteousness about his own defense is what turns me off.  He is dellusional.  Of course, it is his own very human story.  It belongs to the public because he is a public character by his own choice.  His reasoning is out there for all to observe.  It is pathetic that he doesn't really know himself any better than he does. The problem is that if he ever made it to the presidency, this blind spot in his character could be a dangerous thing for the country.  Better to have a crook that knows himself, then a delusional self righteous prig.  Honor comes in many shades of grey, it seems.

Given that Clinton did it (and lied about it), Kennedy did it, Eisenhower did it, Roosevelt did it, Harding did it (big time), and who-knows-who-else did it, does any of this matter at this point -- even if it should matter.  Truman didn't do it and was a good president.  Carter didn't do it and was a bad president.  I agree with Gingrich (even if I don't actually agree with Gingrich) that it was inappropriate for the tabloid media to open the debate yesterday with a question about this.
This man is a pig and a hypocrit.  The fact that so many Republicans are supporting shows how shallow their principles really are.  I hope Newt wins the nomination.  It will serve them all right.

I was having drinks with a couple of gal pals last night, and we conjectured that when Callista takes a shower she probably keeps a periscope thingie focused around the corner on The Newt, just so he doesn’t try to slip out and try to replace her with yet another later, younger model…

For all his bombast and bloviating, again he is just a little man with such a huge, distorted and historic sense of self, and yet probably cannot even tie his own shoelaces.

On top of everything he has said recently, I believe the most despicable is having the daughters of his first wife speak out in his behalf. What a wuss! Sorry folks, but that is a form of child abuse we should never tolerate in any elected official, let alone the President of the United States. Newt had no regard for how he treated his wives, and has less regard about how he treats his daughters. In this sense, he would have no regard in abusing any power handed to him in an election. To determine how someone acts in the future you must examine how they acted in their past.

Newt is just a shameful politician with zero sense of right or wrong, and no regard for the welfare of anyone other than HIMSELF.

Gingrich's shabby treatment of his first and second wives didn't take place in a vacuum. While he was married to his first wife, he was committing adultery with the woman who became his second wife. While he was married to his second wife, he was committing adultery with the woman who became his third wife. In other words, the second and third wives are no better than he is. Somehow, I doubt Gingrich has philandered for the last time, despite his written vow to be faithful - after all, his spoken wedding vows didn't count for much, and it's obvious he's a serial cheater and liar. And any woman who decides to cheat with him will have to be as dumb and morally compromised as the voters who vote for him.
Newt strikes me as the classic narcissist.  The world revolves around him and he's entitled to whatever he wants, including the woman of the moment.
Such a sad person and such a sad country that someone with his thoughts and behaviors could get so far in a presidential contest. When Calista's hair actually moves, we'll know that he's a shoe-in.

Mr. Gingrich - a second class professor (a community college professor?) which more than few insecurities and inflated, irresponsible ego.

The fact that some consider him to be intellectual power house is not a good news about our standards.

He is not not anything special when he feels good about himself, nothing, i.e. nothing really original or creative as far as policy ideas. But when he is defensive his true colors get better of him.

Do we (or the rest of the world) need him to shut down the government as he has done under Clinton?

His relationships and handling of his wives (who marries his high school teacher? A geometry teacher to boot!), his limping leaning on them before he "brilliantly" figures out he needs to dump them ... Does anyone really think he has not been treating the public interest with the same lack of morals?
Mr. Obama gives every appearance of respecting his wife and their marriage appears a true, stable partnership. Bugs the hell out of the "family values" hypocrites.

Newt sees his wives as disposable. Use one until she gets sick from the stress of political life, spin the roll, and tear off another one. He is a classic narcissist by any definition. He sees himself as the center of the universe, above the laws and mores of mere mortals, and unassailable by critics in or out of the media.

By comparison, Obama seems ordinary, humble, and reliable.
Clinton was impeached for lying about his affair.  Not the affair itself.

As Speaker of the House he personally launched impeachment proceedings against President Clinton while having an affair with his present wife. Ask yourself, on what moral grounds does he stand to ask for the far right evangelical vote? He is as flawed as Mitt with his tax issue. This has become quite entertaining! Let us not forget Ron Paul, he is by far the most entertaining of all. Rick, you have one more state and that is that. Looks like a brokered convention in Tampa.

Why in the world did Newt get fined by his own party $300,000. What is behind this scandal.
Investigate, investigate. Put sunlight on the matter. We need to know sooner rather than later just exactly what Newt was tried for and what were the facts about that case. What is Newt hiding and why do we have to wait until after the election to know about his trial before his brethren legislators. Was he fined for being good or was he fined for some matter that even his own party found unacceptable. Here's to the truth and a free ticket back home for Newt with no lobbying stopovers in D.C. He's milked the system enough already. Let him go home and be true to his true-love Callistra.
